news_header: Israel's Defense Minister claims Hezbollah is currently leaderless after recent airstrikes.
news_text: Israeli Defense Minister Yoav Gallant stated that the Lebanese militant group Hezbollah is likely without a leader following the recent airstrike that killed its former leader, Hassan Nasrallah, in late September. Gallant made these remarks during a visit to the northern command center of the Israeli armed forces. The probable successor, Hashem Safieddine, was targeted in an airstrike in Beirut last Friday, but there have been no updates since. Gallant described Hezbollah as a 'wounded organization' without leadership.
